title: La Caña 2015 Albariño (Rías Baixas)
description: This pure, chiseled Albariño is light but right on the nose, with lime and stone aromas. Crisp yet comfortable, the palate delivers nectarine, apple and other familiar white-fruit flavors. A stony finish with crisp acidity and a leesy accent is lasting and attractive.

title: Keuka Spring 2015 Gewürztraminer (Finger Lakes)
description: Rose-petal perfume and pink-grapefruit notes lend a classic nobility to this delicately off-dry Gewürztraminer. It's bold in alcohol but balanced, juxtaposing voluptuous, mouth-filling texture against bright citrusy acidity. Fresh and floral, it finishes long with a lingering tea-tannin astringency.

title: Wente 2014 Morning Fog Chardonnay (Livermore Valley)
description: Civilized and supremely well-behaved, this wine smells just rich enough, with vanilla, ripe pear and lemon, then tastes like it's poised between lemony acidity and a vanillin sweetness. That's a good place to be, and very little oak influence intrudes.

title: Château Tour des Gendres 2014 Conti-ne Périgoudine Parcelle Jeanneton No ZB100 Muscadelle (Bergerac Sec)
description: The Muscadelle gives a ripe perfumed wine. It is fruity while also full of floral and spice flavors. Made from organically grown grapes, it is crisp and direct, full of apricot and pear flavors. Drinkable now, although it will be better from 2017.
designation: Conti-ne Périgoudine Parcelle Jeanneton No ZB100

title: Casa Marin 2009 Lo Abarca Hills Vineyard Pinot Noir (San Antonio)
description: This older offering from a warm year doesn't smell like your average Pinot Noir; it's rich in berry aromas and woodsy smelling. In the mouth, this is a touch blocky, even after six years in bottle. Herbal plum, baked cherry and spice flavors finish toasty, grabby and with lingering heat.

title: Casas del Toqui 2015 Coastal Mist Terroir Selection Sauvignon Blanc (Colchagua Valley)
description: This is cool-coast Chilean SB from front to back. Vegetal-leaning aromas of asparagus, cactus and lime are what the Paredones microzone has become known for. This tastes slightly pickled and intense, with coastal green-fruit notes leading the finish. High acidity ensure that this is super racy.

title: Cave de Cleebourg 2014 Prestige Gewurztraminer (Alsace)
description: Damask rose and honeysuckle add their sumptuous perfume to the scent of ripe peaches. Balanced and bright, the palate conveys full-fruited notes of juicy yellow plums. This wine is all about fruit and blossom, spun in a web of rounded, warm freshness.

title: Domaine Chaintreuil 2014 La Madone Vieilles Vignes  (Fleurie)
description: Produced from a selection of old vines, this is a structured firm wine. Its black-cherry fruits and acidity are well integrated into the dense structure to give a spicy wine that is richly packed with fruits. Drink now and until 2020.

title: Domaine Charles Frey 2013 Clos St Sebastien Gewurztraminer (Alsace)
description: Subdued hints of lily and jasmine rise from the glass. The palate offers restrained notes of peach and Mirabelle plum, with a rounded, off-dry finish focusing on blossom honey. It's a gentle, rounded and perfumed wine.

title: Camel Valley 2013 Cornwall Rosé Pinot Noir (England)
description: Faint hints of red currant join the creamy notes on the nose. The palate falls in with more fresh berry fruit and paints a picture of utter charm. The mousse is creamy and fine, supporting those tender, lithe berry notes. This is one for a balmy summer night and someone you love.

title: Andrew Januik 2013 Stone Cairn Cabernet Sauvignon (Red Mountain)
description: Aromas of prune, licorice and dark fruit lead to full cranberry and cherry flavors. It shows a sense of vitality and liveliness.

title: Ardor 2013 Lawrence Vineyard Syrah (Columbia Valley (WA))
description: This wine starts out brooding, with aromas of vanilla, herbs and brown spices. The cherry flavors are full bodied yet show subtlety, with a captivating mouthfeel and meaty flavors on the finish that increase the interest.

title: Array 2013 Nina's Reserve Chardonnay (Washington)
description: Sur lie aging and battonage were extended for 22 months on this wine. It displays aromas of corn silk, almond milk and lees that are followed by an elegant creamy mouthfeel and abundant stone-fruit flavors. The finish lingers.

title: Novelty Hill 2013 Stillwater Creek Vineyard Grenache (Columbia Valley (WA))
description: Light aromas of baking spices and red and black raspberries lead to plentiful red-fruit flavors. It lingers on the finish.

title: OZV 2014 Red (California)
description: This wine is deep in color and even deeper and darker in flavor. Aromas of charred wood, black pepper and grilled meat lead to equally savory, smoky flavors. A juicy blackberry core lightens and almost sweetens the overall impression.

title: Pahlmeyer 2014 Jayson Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)
description: With 5% Cabernet Franc in the blend, this wine is generous in sticky, sweetened tannin and expansive black fruit, the weight full bodied and robust. Made in a ripe, volumptuous style, it finishes in coconut shavings.

title: Parducci 2015 Small Lot Blend Pinot Gris (Mendocino County)
description: This delicious, flavorful and well-balanced wine plays ripeness and brightness beautifully off each other for a refreshing and satisfying taste overall. It's medium bodied, dry and appetizing.

title: Structure 2013 Foundation Syrah (Columbia Valley (WA))
description: Bright aromas of raspberries, flowers, potpourri and herbs are followed by a full-bodied palate. It finishes a bit linear.

title: Robert Renzoni 2015 Julia's Vineyard Pinot Grigio (Temecula Valley)
description: Clean yellow apple, scratched yellow-grapefruit skin and minerally cement-laced notes make for a grippy nose on this light and fresh bottling. Light stonefruit flavors meet with lime zest on the tasty, straightforward sip, proving quite refreshing all around.

title: Savage Grace 2014 Celilo Vineyard Chardonnay (Columbia Gorge (WA))
description: After starting out slightly reduced, the aromas of lemon pith, wet stone and oyster shell bring appeal. The feel is broad and generous, backed by tart, well-balanced acidity and a lingering finish.

title: Saviah 2014 The Jack Red (Columbia Valley (WA))
description: Aromas of blue fruit, herb and a kiss of vanilla are followed by generous, thoroughly enchanting blue and black-fruit flavors. The Syrah plays prominently in the symphony but it's the balance that provides the most appeal. Coffee flavors flesh out the finish.

title: Frédéric Mallo 2013 Réserve Spéciale Riesling (Alsace)
description: Earth and smoke blend into the citrus notes of this concentrated Riesling. The palate is poised and linear, defined by bright freshness and lovely pithy citus notes. Towards the finish this gets broader and is reminiscent of bruised apple.

title: Fox Run 2014 Semi-Dry Riesling (Finger Lakes)
description: Invigorating aromas of fresh pineapple and lemon introduce this crisp semi-dry Riesling. The palate is brisk but concentrated offering generous tangerine and white peach flavors that linger sweetly on the palate.

title: Domaine Gresser 2015 Kritt Gewurztraminer (Alsace)
description: Creamy earthiness joins the yellow stone fruit on nose and palate, making for a toned-down but full-fruited, generously rounded Gewurztraminer. The structure provided by pithy, pleasantly bitter notes leaves a lasting, refreshing impact.

title: Leyda 2013 Single Vineyard Las Brisas Pinot Noir (Leyda Valley)
description: Spiced plum, dried raspberry and cherry-cough-drop aromas are attractive. This feels medium in body, with plumpness cut by fresh acidity. Flavors of dried cherry and baking spices finish solidly and smoothly.

title: Domaine Pfister 2014 Tradition Riesling (Alsace)
description: Notes of stone and smoke join lemon and green apple on the nose of this wine. The palate has an earthier aspect but is bracingly fresh and precise with pure lemon zestiness. Dry and slender, the wine will round out with some bottle age. Drink 2018–2023.

title: Domaine Schoffit 2014 Lieu Dit Harth Tradition Riesling (Alsace)
description: An unusual edge of licorice clings to nose and palate of this fresh, zingy Riesling. The streamlined body is dry and pervaded by brisk, friendly lemon freshness.

title: Dopff & Irion 2015 Cuvée René Dopff Pinot Gris (Alsace)
description: This wine is juicy and appetizing.Creamy notes of ripe Bosc pear play with freshness and verve on nose and palate. The body is textured but dry, with a welcome vein of zesty freshness at its center.

title: Januik 2014 Cold Creek Vineyard Chardonnay (Columbia Valley (WA))
description: Bright aromas of pear, peach, baking spice and malolactic notes lead to a sleek yet creamy palate. It loses its rhythm a touch in the middle but comes back together.

title: Joseph Cattin 2015 Riesling (Alsace)
description: Soft citrus notes of clementine are streaked with fresh lemon to create this fresh, fruit-driven but very appetizing wine. The body is slender, dry and totally refreshing.
